page.title: 16THE CHURCH AT BEAFORD
page.content: St. George's Church, Beaford is built of stone, and consists of a chancel, nave, south aisle, south porch, vestry, and a bell tower on the west. The tower, capped by a steeple, was erected in 1910, and contains 6 bells. The font is ancient and there is good carving in the roof. The church was re-stored, and re-seated, and the windows re-glazed in 1878-9. A new stone pulpit, a chancel screen, a lecturn and reading desk were also installed at this time. Over the south porch is an ancient sundial. The old stocks kept in the church were once used in the churchyard. The register dates from 1643. Today the church is served by a vicar responsible for 3 parishes, Beaford, Roborough and St. Giles. Each church has one service per Sunday, times being on a rota basis.
